intro: Neobakeria burchellii, commonly known as the Burchell's milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy texture, while its stems are covered in fine, white hairs. Neobakeria burchellii is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
